docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 28--Rumors of another pending naval engagement near the South American coast were revived today when it became known that the British South Atlantic Squadron had been assembled in the vicinity of the mouth of the River...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 28--Rumors of another pending naval engagement near the South American coast were revived today when it became known that the British South Atlantic Squadron had been assembled in the vicinity of the mouth of the River Plate.
docs.abstract: Brit South Atlantic Squadron assembled near River Plate mouth revives rumors of pending battle; Uruguay tries to locate secret radio stations believed to be reptg Brit cruiser movements to German warship

headline.main: FIGHT OFF URUGUAY IS HELD TO BE NEAR; Unexpected, Hurried Activity of British Cruiser Gives Rise to Reports FLAGSHIP FUELED HASTILY Sister Craft Fails to Arrive on Schedule--Rumors of Raider Persistent

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: George S. Messersmith, the new United States Ambassador to Cuba, sailed yesterday on the Oriente of the New York and Cuba Mail Line to take up his new post in Havana.
docs.lead_paragraph: George S. Messersmith, the new United States Ambassador to Cuba, sailed yesterday on the Oriente of the New York and Cuba Mail Line to take up his new post in Havana.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO Uruguay, Feb. 29 --Eight seamen from the German cargo steamer Lahn have deserted as a result of reports that British warships no longer pick up the crews of scuttled German vessels.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO Uruguay, Feb. 29 --Eight seamen from the German cargo steamer Lahn have deserted as a result of reports that British warships no longer pick up the crews of scuttled German vessels.
docs.abstract: 8 seamen desert from Gentian freighter Lahn following repts that Brit warships no longer pick up crews of scuttled ships, Montevideo

headline.main: 8 GERMANS DESERT SHIP AT MONTEVIDEO; Hear British Will No Longer Save Crews of Scuttled Vessels

docs.snippet: England's "blacklist" of companies operated by "enemy" interests in neutral countries has been increased by the addition of seventyfive new names, according to copies of the latest amendment reaching here from England.
docs.lead_paragraph: England's "blacklist" of companies operated by "enemy" interests in neutral countries has been increased by the addition of seventyfive new names, according to copies of the latest amendment reaching here from England.
docs.abstract: Brit blacklist of enemy interests in neutral countries revised; list

headline.main: ENGLAND EXPANDS TRADE 'BLACKLIST'; Adds 75 Companies to Those Already Cited as 'Enemies' in Neutral Nations FOR NAMES ARE DELETED Corrections Are Made in Other Listings--No U.S. Concern Is Included

docs.snippet: The British freighter Southgate yesterday reported herself attacked by a submarine approximately 130 miles northeast of San Juan, Puerto Rico, and apparently well inside the neutrality zone averaging 300 miles proclaimed by the Panama Conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: The British freighter Southgate yesterday reported herself attacked by a submarine approximately 130 miles northeast of San Juan, Puerto Rico, and apparently well inside the neutrality zone averaging 300 miles proclaimed by the Panama Conference.
docs.abstract: German freighter Troja set afire by crew after interception by Brit cruiser; map

headline.main: SHIP REPORTS U--BOAT ATTACK IN U. S. ZONE; REDS ENTERING VIBORG, LEFT AFIRE BY FINNS; WELLES TOLD NAZI AIMS, SEES HITLER TODAY; AID SPED TO VESSEL 3 Destroyers and Coast Guard Cutter on Way to British Freighter CRAFT OFF PUERTO RICO No Details of Attack Given-- German Ship Is Scuttled Off Netherland West Indies
